message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper focuses on improving the performance of neural machine translation (NMT) for Japanese-English translation by addressing the issue of high vocabulary size caused by Japanese predicate conjugation. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the categories of natural language processing (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper proposes methods using conjugation information, which can be considered as a form of feature engineering, making it relevant to the category of neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper also evaluates the performance of the proposed methods using BLEU scores, which is a common evaluation metric in computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing.
